first_reasoning: Allocating the $10 million to the Industrial Products Division delivers the most reliable, rapid payback and the strongest risk-adjusted return. With proven processes and supplier relationships already in place, a moderate margin lift can be realized in 12–18 months to cover our investment in roughly two years and generate an NPV of $4–6 million at a 10% discount rate. In contrast, Consumer’s longer development cycle, higher execution risk and lower NPV make it a less attractive option given our time-sensitive board mandate.
second_reasoning: We allocate twelve million to Consumer—eleven million for breakthrough product development plus one million to establish a dedicated program‐management office—because the governance enhancements will ensure discipline around scope and timing while preserving ample firepower for creative innovation. The remaining eight million goes to Industrial to fund targeted efficiency and incremental improvements that management can execute quickly, delivering margin relief and stemming ongoing losses. This split balances the need for a high-impact Consumer turnaround with reliable, near-term gains in Industrial.
